resources.string: Characteristics are modified.\n"Test Again" enables to reiterate object accessibility test.
You need to accept the permissions to use this app
OCARA is born in Meylan (France) at the Orange research laboratory

OCARA, Outil de Contrôle et d’Analyse du Réel Accessible (Real word Auditing Tool), is an auditing tool for buildings accessibility. User define the path, and can check accessibility rules taking into account several kinds of impairment.
OCARA is a complete auditing tool that can address several sets of rules, that can be personalized. It enables to test objects, paths and areas.

OCARA was developed by Orange Labs, for Orange Disability Human Resources Mission and for Real Property Branch. Accessibility rules are based upon several legible documents and from employees needs. Other new sets can be added, your owns sets.
Orange decided to go open-source with OCARA in order to offer to every company or association the ability to check accessibility and to provide design for all, and to improve this software.
Accessibility is a well known subject that has to be taken into account in each company at least in the frame of Social responsibility. This is a mainframe for well being at work.
Sharing through open source is the best way to go further.
OCARA is born in Meylan (France) at the Orange research laboratory. It was initiated by Denis Ch�ne and performed by Gilles Zanolin.

For your first visit, this tutorial aims to show you how to download your very first referential. You can either press Next to got to the next step, or press Skip to go straight to the app.
Ocara displays the referentials that are currently available. Select the referential to download.
View the information about the referential before downloading it.
Clic to start downloading. The process may take a few seconds. Once it ends, a success message shows up, and you can display the whole content.
The referential with a green flag is ready to use. You can now start a new audit with it.
